sn35.33-42:0.3: 33–42. Ten on Liable to Be Reborn, Etc.
sn35.33-42:1.3: “Mendicants, all is liable to be reborn.
sn35.33-42:1.4: And what is the all that is liable to be reborn?
sn35.33-42:1.8: and eye contact are liable to be reborn.
sn35.33-42:1.9: And the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact is also liable to be reborn.
sn35.33-42:1.16: The mind, thoughts, mind consciousness, and mind contact are liable to be reborn.
sn35.33-42:1.17: And the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact is also liable to be reborn.
sn35.33-42:1.18: Seeing this a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned …
sn35.33-42:1.19: They understand: ‘… there is no return to any state of existence.’”
sn35.33-42:2.1: “Mendicants, all is liable to grow old. …”
sn35.33-42:3.1: “Mendicants, all is liable to fall sick. …”
sn35.33-42:6.1: “Mendicants, all is liable to be corrupted. …”
